trxcllnt commented on issue #3630: ARROW-4550: [JS] Fix AMD pattern
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3630#issuecomment-463047231
 
 
   This looks ok to me. IIRC I used one of the [standard UMD templates](https://github.com/umdjs/umd), and possibly modified it to match Webpack's [`umdNamedDefine`](https://webpack.js.org/configuration/output/#outputumdnameddefine) output. I haven't used AMD in quite a while, so :+1: from me if this fixes it for @mbostock

mbostock commented on issue #3630: ARROW-4550: [JS] Fix AMD pattern
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3630#issuecomment-463309733
 
 
   @TheNeuralBit Yes, if you have the generated file somewhere, you can require the URL. GitHub makes this a little tricky because they force the content-type to be text/plain, but you can workaround that like so:
   
   ```js
   require(await fetch("https://gist.githubusercontent.com/mbostock/f421358acd00c94badaceed4d4034d36/raw/51026b908d68b94e191e8b4f3d5f46c41a4e00ac/amd-test.js").then(response => response.blob()).then(blob => URL.createObjectURL(blob)))
   ```
   
   https://beta.observablehq.com/d/9e7bac640df7d65a
   
   https://gist.github.com/mbostock/f421358acd00c94badaceed4d4034d36
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

mbostock commented on issue #3630: ARROW-4550: [JS] Fix AMD pattern
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3630#issuecomment-463309733
 
 
   @TheNeuralBit Yes, if you have the generated file somewhere, you can require the URL. GitHub makes this a little tricky because they force the content-type to be text/plain, but you can workaround that like so:
   
   ```js
   require(await fetch("https://gist.githubusercontent.com/mbostock/f421358acd00c94badaceed4d4034d36/raw/51026b908d68b94e191e8b4f3d5f46c41a4e00ac/amd-test.js").then(response => response.blob()).then(blob => URL.createObjectURL(blob)))
   ```
   
   Alternatively you can require a local file:
   
   ```js
   viewof file = html`<input type=file accept=.js>`
   ```
   ```js
   require(await Files.url(file))
   ```
   
   https://beta.observablehq.com/d/9e7bac640df7d65a
   
   https://gist.github.com/mbostock/f421358acd00c94badaceed4d4034d36
   
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on GitHub and use the

wesm commented on issue #3630: ARROW-4550: [JS] Fix AMD pattern
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3630#issuecomment-474879599
 
 
   Yes, in the future, when something like this comes up, I would recommend being a "squeaky wheel" until you get what you need. The community must be given the opportunity to inspect the software before publishing it to NPM (a good thing IMHO, in light of some of the problems the ecosystem has had) but the release process is not complicated

TheNeuralBit commented on issue #3630: ARROW-4550: [JS] Fix AMD pattern
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3630#issuecomment-474904736
 
 
   Sorry @mbostock you're right we should've been on top of this. 
   
   I'm in favor of cutting an 0.4.1 release ASAP, all the JIRAs tagged for that release are [already closed](https://issues.apache.org/jira/projects/ARROW/versions/12344961) and several of them are bugfixes for 0.4.0. We can integrate with the mainline releases after that.
